cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeast Gulf, then turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast and the Alabama/Florida-Panhandle area
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Alabama–Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (interests from Mississippi to central Florida Panhandle advised to monitor)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Mississippi to the central Florida Panhandle; inland track into the Southeast/Tennessee Valley
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Boston, MA not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: None — gale-force winds are not forecast to reach Boston, MA
weather_observation.storm_surge: None — surge impacts confined to northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rainfall: None — heaviest rain limited to Gulf Coast and interior Southeast
